channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dangerous road consigns no signage, needs gritting due to icy conditions, 10th January
item.description:
The burst watermain is making the road extremely icy causing multiple motorcyclist to fall off and cars nearly piling into them

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbots Way, Upper Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish piled up off Penton Place (still!), 10th January
item.description:
Southwark Council say this issue has been resolved which is not true so I'm reporting again. There is still a pile of rubbish dumped behind the row of shops off Penton Place. This needs to be cleared.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 4, Penton Place, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Excessive left outside The Poplars building, 10th January
item.description:
There is a serious issue with fly tipping on Queens Drive in general and there is consistently debris left outside The Poplars.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queens Drive, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Why is Ruskin avenue neglected??, 10th January
item.description:
Ruskin avenue is neglected!! I have never seen a road sweeper in the years that I have lived here but regularly I see them daily on the main road and other side streets. My property is near an alleyway with flats above the commercial units below. Thy don’t have use of any bins that I know of and use mine and my neighbours bins so when we go to take waste out the bins are already full. The area outside our door has become a dumping ground with regular missed re cycle collections, rats attacking bags on floor as no space in bins and people dumping old items like suitcases etc. we need a road sweeper and some control of fly ripping by people behind the shops to have their own bins so they so they don’t discard their rubbish outside our properties

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ruskin Avenue, Welling, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside the flats, 10th January
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 67, Plender Street, St Pancras, Greater London

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oldfield Road, Bickley, Greater London

item.title: Broken glass near play park in Pickhurst Park, 10th January
item.description:
There is a lot of broken glass near the play park in Pickhurst Park in Pickhurst Lane. Many children and dogs use this park and could easily injure themselves on the glass. Would you please arrange for the glass to be swept up and removed ASAP.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Draven Close, Hayes, Greater London

item.title: 48 teignmpouth, 10th January
item.description:

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Teignmouth Road, London

item.title: Recycling bins overflowing, 10th January
item.description:
Recycling bins overflowing since Christmas, I understand due to the Christmas season things would be a little slower, BUT January 10th Saturday visiting family in Haynes house and this, completely unacceptable,

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Barnabas Road, London

item.title: Dalkeith Road SE21 streetlight column ID number 9 (/, 10th January
item.description:
Dalkeith Road SE21 streetlight column ID number 9 (/ side of house number 4 Turney Rd) control parking bay permit information sign painted over. NB This is over 6 foot off the ground so your normal graffiti contract with Serco will not apply to this it. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin and picture (other graffiti in picture already reported).

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Dalkeith Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dalkeith Road SE21 cycle locker, 10th January
item.description:
Dalkeith Road SE21 a few feet from streetlight column ID number 9 (/ side of house number 4 Turney Rd) green coloured power coated metal Lambeth cycle locker graffiti tagged. Please forward fixmystreet.com link to your contractor for reporting pin and picture.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Dalkeith Road, Tulse Hill, Greater London
